text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 2.3.76.1 has been revised to include Program, Scope, and Objectives.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, AND W&I.

) Overview: This IRM section provides an overview of the ISTSD Command Code. and (
) Purpose: This IRM contains procedural steps for use of the ISTSD Code. An Innocent-Spouse-Tracking-Record is added to a module on IDRS whenever a Form
is ﬁled with the Service. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees who are responsible the processing of Innocent Spouse records. These employees are located in the following areas: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (
) Policy Owner: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for ing all aspects of our systems that operate the nation’s tax infrastructure. (
) Program Owner: MITS. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (

) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for employees who work with Innocent Spouse cases. By following the processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees process Innocent spouse cases in a manner that follows IRS policy and dures while promoting the best interests of the Government. (
) ISTSD may be entered in three ways. Command Code ISTSE may be asked to pass a case to ISTSD to be deleted. See IRM
for details. Using Code ISTSR deﬁner S offers the same service. See IRM
ISTSD may entered directly by inputting the Primary taxpayer’s TIN (formatted), the MFT and Tax Period, and the Case File-Code and Claim-Number. For exact placement see Exhibit
These ﬁelds will be validated, and the user will be notiﬁed of any errors. (
) If the case is found, an approval screen will be displayed. See Exhibit
The identiﬁcation information for the case is displayed as well as ﬁrst

stages/comments. The user can tab to an entry ﬁeld after the ’DO YOU REALLY WANT TO DELETE THIS CASE?’ An entry of ’Y’ will cause the delete. If ’N’ is entered, no delete will take place. Anything else results in an error message. ISTSD will then acknowledge what was entered and act accordingly. (
) ISTSD deﬁner U may be entered in two ways. Command Code ISTSR S will pass off to ISTSD. See IRM

ISTSD will interrogate the Cases of the passed off request to determine if a delete or a restore is required. (01-01-2009) Deleting Cases Using ISTSD
ISTSD deﬁner U may be entered in two ways. Command Code ISTSR deﬁner S will pass off to ISTSD. See IRM

ISTSD will interrogate the Filer-Code of the passed off request to determine if a delete or a restore is required. ISTSD may be entered directly by inputting the Primary taxpayer’s TIN (formatted), the Module MFT and Tax Period, and the Case Filer-Code and Claim-Number. For exact placement see Exhibit
These ﬁelds will be validated, and the user will be notiﬁed of any errors. If the case is found, an approval screen will be displayed. See Exhibit
The identiﬁcation information for the case is displayed as well as the

If the case is found, an approval screen will be displayed. See Exhibit 2.3.76–4. The identiﬁcation information for the case is displayed as well as the ﬁrst 32 stages/comments. The user can tab to an entry ﬁeld after the question ’DO YOU REALLY WANT TO RESTORE THIS CASE?’ An entry of ’Y’ will
cause the restore. If ’N’ is entered, no restore will take place. Any other response is an error. ISTSD will then acknowledge what was entered and act accordingly.
